title: So warwick is going to go back to utter obscurity after this patch...
body:
I get it.  Warwick, right now, is an absolute monster.  However, this is also the first real play that he is getting on a large scale besides a few very dedicated players since S2.  Believe me, I get that he needs a nerf, hes at a 90% ban ratio and a 60% win ratio.

But they are sending him back to oblivion with the upcoming PBE nerfs.  W duration reduced to 6 from 10 seconds, ult losing 100 damage at rank 1, 85 at rank 2 and 70 at rank 3.

Skirmishers is already getting changed so that he can't use it, but those changes aren't even on live and your going to hit Warwick again.  His ult is going to be useless until he gets an on-hit item, so bye bye CDR tankwick.   He is going to go from the most banned/picked champ to one of the least again in just one patch.  And most dedicated warwick players, myself included, aren't even going to want to come back to him.  He's been gutted.

Riot, with this latest banishment of warwick to the abyss of LOL champs that you don't like, where you leave them untouched after smiting them  for YEARS, can we at least get a promise that his rework is going to be moved up in the timeline so that at some point we can play the wolf again?

replies.body:
To be fair, he's like the jungle Garen.

Too easy to be allowed to be strong, and at least safe for his low power.
My guess is that they're putting him on the shelf for his rework later (I'm hoping for an early 2015 release on the rework).

[I wouldn't get your hopes up for that](https://twitter.com/RiotMorello/status/538799009985335296)

There has been talk of his rework as far back as the end of season 2 and we mostly get the above response when it is asked about. 

I'm still extremely upset the kit that was spoiled earlier this year was scrapped.

I'm confused how he is still so low on the list when all it took was a new item and slight changes to the jungle to make him ridiculously broken. He needs a rework not a bunch of nerfs.

I kind of meant "early 2015" as "first half of 2015"; I figured there was some progress being made since they actually bothered to scrap Zenon's rework (no need to get rid of it if they weren't looking at him anytime soon). Maybe I'm too hopeful but I was thinking he might be up next after Poppy and Tristana, since there seems to be more discussion about him than like, Yorick or something. Like, turnover for Soraka rework was pretty quick, fairly soon after she became a problem (not sure how long before then she was in the works, though).

ChampUp has been doing a heck of a lot of work recently though, and it's likely too that Riot is hesitant about making definite statements since they do run into delays sometimes and rather not disappoint people.

I doubt these numbers will be left the same. Some adjusting, and he won't be as much of a monster.

I'm waiting for the rework though:)

Frankly, the issue is with the challenging smite + devourer item. The issue is that it synergizes TOO WELL with ANY attack speed or multi-hit champion since the true damage is per basic attack and the bonus magic damage is on-hit.

I could think of a few different options that wouldn't absolutely maim Warwick's potential:

1. Halve Infinite Duress' on-hit effectiveness. 

This keeps his damage that people love Warwick for but also reduces the effectiveness of the Skirmisher's Blade that makes him so overpowered.

2. Adjust the On-Hit magic damage scaling.

Make big monster camps only increase the damage by .5 or .75.

TL;DR is that Warwick was perfectly fine beforehand. Especially after Infinite Duress' recent cooldown nerf. They didn't need to butcher his abilities when they could have butchered the items that made him too powerful.
The smite and devour changes are.enough to tone him down. They didn't really need to nerf his.buff and ultimate while they were at it. Feral Flare was much stronger.than devour and yet WW was fine.
